en: The SARS-CoV-2 virus is the cause of COVID-19 (coronavirus disease 2019), a contagious respiratory disease that was first identified in December 2019, in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
es: El virus SARS-CoV-2 es la causa de la COVID-19 (enfermedad del coronavirus 2019), una enfermedad respiratoria contagiosa que se identificó por primera vez en diciembre de 2019, en Wuhan, Hubei, China.
atomic_facts: ["The SARS-CoV-2 virus is the cause of COVID-19.", "COVID-19 is a contagious respiratory disease.", "COVID-19 was first identified in December 2019.", "COVID-19 was first identified in Wuhan, Hubei, China."]

en: It was declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO) on 11 March 2020.
es: La Organización Mundial de la Salud (OMS) la declaró una pandemia el 11 de marzo de 2020.
atomic_facts: ["It was declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO).", "The declaration of pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO) was on 11 March 2020."]

en: Older people and those with underlying conditions are the most at risk of serious complications including death.
es: Las personas mayores y aquellas con afecciones subyacentes son las que tienen mayor riesgo de sufrir complicaciones graves, incluida la muerte.
atomic_facts: ["Older people are at risk of serious complications including death.", "Those with underlying conditions are at risk of serious complications including death."]

en: Due to the spread of the disease, you are advised not to travel unless necessary, to avoid being infected, quarantined, or stranded by changing restrictions and cancelled flights.
es: Debido a la propagación de la enfermedad, se le recomienda que no viaje a menos que sea necesario, para evitar contagiarse, ser puesto en cuarentena o quedar varado en otro lugar debido a las cambiantes restricciones y los vuelos cancelados.
atomic_facts: ["You are advised not to travel unless necessary due to the spread of the disease.", "You are advised to avoid being infected due to the spread of the disease.", "You are advised to avoid being quarantined due to the spread of the disease.", "You are advised to avoid being stranded due to the spread of the disease.", "Changing restrictions may cause you to be stranded.", "Cancelled flights may cause you to be stranded."]

en: This is not just to protect you, but also those you come in contact with.
es: Esto no solo es para protegerlo a usted, sino también a las personas con las que tiene contacto.
atomic_facts: ["This is to protect you.", "This is to protect those you come in contact with."]

en: As it happens, you probably aren't missing much by staying home, as many attractions around the world are closing their doors to avoid spreading the disease.
es: De hecho, es probable que no se pierda de mucho por quedarse en casa, ya que muchas de las atracciones en todo el mundo están cerrando sus puertas para evitar la propagación de la enfermedad.
atomic_facts: ["You probably aren't missing much by staying home.", "Many attractions around the world are closing their doors.", "The attractions are closing to avoid spreading the disease."]

en: If you do need to travel, take precautions as you would for other infections: wash your hands frequently, avoid touching your face, cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and avoid contact with sick people.
es: Si necesita viajar, tome las precauciones que tomaría para otras infecciones: lávese las manos con frecuencia, evite tocarse el rostro, cúbrase con la parte interna del codo o con un pañuelo al toser o estornudar y evite el contacto con personas enfermas.
atomic_facts: ["You should take precautions if you need to travel.", "You should wash your hands frequently to prevent infection.", "You should avoid touching your face to prevent infection.", "You should cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue to prevent infection.", "You should avoid contact with sick people to prevent infection."]

en: Before traveling, read up on the extensive and fast-changing array of travel restrictions that have been imposed around the world.
es: Antes de viajar, lea la amplia y rápidamente cambiante variedad de restricciones de viaje que se han impuesto en todo el mundo.
atomic_facts: ["Travel restrictions have been imposed around the world.", "The array of travel restrictions is extensive.", "The array of travel restrictions is fast-changing."]

en: After travel, monitor your health and consider self-isolation for two weeks to avoid transmitting the disease to others.
es: Después de viajar, controle su estado de salud y considere aislarse de los demás por dos semanas para evitar el contagio de la enfermedad.
atomic_facts: ["After travel, monitor your health.", "Consider self-isolation for two weeks after travel.", "Self-isolation for two weeks can help avoid transmitting the disease to others."]

en: Transportation from long-distance passenger flights to local buses has been curtailed or completely shut down in many countries due to low demand or government orders.
es: En muchos países, se ha limitado o suspendido completamente el transporte desde los viajes de pasajeros de larga distancia hasta los autobuses locales debido a la baja demanda o a órdenes gubernamentales.
atomic_facts: ["Transportation from long-distance passenger flights has been curtailed or completely shut down in many countries due to low demand or government orders."]

en: Many international and regional borders are closed.
es: Se han cerrado muchas fronteras internacionales y regionales.
atomic_facts: ["Many international borders are closed.", "Many regional borders are closed."]

en: If you are away from home, and especially if you are in another country, consider returning home as soon as possible; this may get even more difficult as restrictions continue to change.
es: Si se encuentra lejos de su casa y, en especial, si está en otro país, considere volver a su casa tan pronto como sea posible; es probable que esto se vuelva incluso más difícil a medida que cambien las restricciones.
atomic_facts: ["You are away from home.", "Consider returning home as soon as possible.", "Restrictions continue to change.", "Returning home may get even more difficult as restrictions continue to change."]

en: They may be able to organize an evacuation, identify non-regularly scheduled flights, or give you an emergency loan to pay for transport.
es: Es posible que ellos puedan organizar una evacuación, identificar vuelos que no estén programados de manera regular o darle un préstamo de emergencia para pagar el transporte.
atomic_facts: ["They may be able to organize an evacuation.", "They may be able to identify non-regularly scheduled flights.", "They may be able to give you an emergency loan to pay for transport."]

en: As of early April 2020, the number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 is approaching one million.
es: Al mes de abril de 2020, la cantidad de casos confirmados de COVID-19 se acerca a un millón.
atomic_facts: ["The number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 is approaching one million as of early April 2020."]

en: Though the disease started in mainland China, it has spread around the world and China has fewer confirmed cases and deaths than several other countries.
es: Aunque la enfermedad empezó en China continental, se ha propagado al resto del mundo y China tiene menos casos confirmados y muertes que varios de los otros países.
atomic_facts: ["The disease started in mainland China.", "The disease has spread around the world.", "China has fewer confirmed cases than several other countries.", "China has fewer deaths than several other countries."]

en: All but a handful of countries have reported at least one case, with the highest numbers of reported cases in the United States, Spain, Italy, Germany, France, mainland China, Iran, and the United Kingdom.
es: Todos los países, salvo unos cuantos, han declarado tener al menos un caso; los que tienen el mayor número de casos confirmados son Estados Unidos, España, Italia, Alemania, Francia, China continental y el Reino Unido.
atomic_facts: ["All but a handful of countries have reported at least one case.", "The United States has reported one of the highest numbers of cases.", "Spain has reported one of the highest numbers of cases.", "Italy has reported one of the highest numbers of cases.", "Germany has reported one of the highest numbers of cases.", "France has reported one of the highest numbers of cases.", "Mainland China has reported one of the highest numbers of cases.", "Iran has reported one of the highest numbers of cases.", "The United Kingdom has reported one of the highest numbers of cases."]

en: Local transmission is established in many countries in all major inhabited regions of the world except some Pacific island nations.
es: Se ha establecido la transmisión local en muchos países, en todas las regiones de mayor población del mundo, con excepción de algunas naciones de las islas del Pacífico.
atomic_facts: ["Local transmission is established in many countries.", "Local transmission is not established in some Pacific island nations."]

en: (See updates from the WHO.)
es: (Consulte las actualizaciones de la OMS).
atomic_facts: ["There are updates from the WHO."]

en: Many countries are experiencing a severe shortage of test kits, and the authorities have not been able to test everybody who is at high risk, so the real number of cases is probably much higher than the official one.
es: Muchos países tienen una marcada escasez de kits de prueba y las autoridades no han podido hacerle la prueba a toda la población de riesgo, por lo que la cantidad real de casos probablemente sea mucho más alta que la oficial.
atomic_facts: ["Many countries are experiencing a severe shortage of test kits.", "The authorities have not been able to test everybody who is at high risk.", "The real number of cases is probably much higher than the official one."]

en: Countries also differ in their testing and reporting practices, so comparisons of the number of reported cases do not tell the full story of how the epidemic has progressed in different areas.
es: Los países también difieren unos de otros en sus prácticas de realización de las pruebas y elaboración de informes, por lo que las comparaciones del número de casos confirmados no indican a ciencia cierta cómo ha progresado la epidemia en distintas áreas.
atomic_facts: ["Countries differ in their testing practices.", "Countries differ in their reporting practices.", "Comparisons of the number of reported cases do not tell the full story of how the epidemic has progressed in different areas."]

en: The coronavirus is a relatively large virus, meaning it is not truly airborne: it will settle down in respiratory droplets.
es: El coronavirus es un virus relativamente grande; esto quiere decir que realmente no se puede transportar en el aire: se posa junto con las gotitas respiratorias.
atomic_facts: ["The coronavirus is a relatively large virus.", "The coronavirus is not truly airborne.", "The coronavirus will settle down in respiratory droplets."]

en: Staying two metres (six feet) away from other people is usually enough to prevent transmission through this route.
es: Mantenerse a una distancia de dos metros (seis pies) de las demás personas generalmente es suficiente para prevenir la transmisión por este medio.
atomic_facts: ["Staying two metres away from other people is usually enough to prevent transmission through this route.", "Staying six feet away from other people is usually enough to prevent transmission through this route."]

en: The SARS-CoV-2 virus may last on cardboard for up to 24 hours and on plastic for up to 3 days.
es: El virus SARS-CoV-2 puede durar en las superficies de cartón por hasta 24 horas y en el plástico por hasta 3 días.
atomic_facts: ["The SARS-CoV-2 virus may last on cardboard for up to 24 hours.", "The SARS-CoV-2 virus may last on plastic for up to 3 days."]

en: Transmission via the fecal–oral route may also be possible.
es: También es posible la transmisión vía fecal/oral.
atomic_facts: ["Transmission via the fecal–oral route may be possible."]

en: Evidence suggests that COVID-19 is contagious even without symptoms, though to what extent is still being investigated.
es: La evidencia sugiere que la COVID-19 es contagiosa incluso sin síntomas, aunque todavía se está investigando en qué medida lo es.
atomic_facts: ["Evidence suggests that COVID-19 is contagious even without symptoms.", "The extent to which COVID-19 is contagious without symptoms is still being investigated."]

en: Common symptoms include a fever, dry cough, and fatigue.
es: Entre los síntomas comunes se incluyen la fiebre, la tos seca y la fatiga.
atomic_facts: ["Common symptoms include a fever.", "Common symptoms include a dry cough.", "Common symptoms include fatigue."]

en: Other less common symptoms include shortness of breath, a sore throat, headache, muscle pain, or sputum production.
es: Otros síntomas menos comunes incluyen falta de aliento, dolor de garganta, dolor de cabeza, dolor muscular o producción de esputo.
atomic_facts: ["Other less common symptoms include shortness of breath", "Other less common symptoms include a sore throat", "Other less common symptoms include headache", "Other less common symptoms include muscle pain", "Other less common symptoms include sputum production"]

en: Serious complications include pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, and multi-organ failure leading to disability or death.
es: Las complicaciones graves incluyen neumonía, síndrome de dificultad respiratoria aguda y fallo multiorgánico que puede causar una discapacidad o la muerte.
atomic_facts: ["Serious complications include pneumonia.", "Serious complications include acute respiratory distress syndrome.", "Serious complications include multi-organ failure.", "Multi-organ failure can lead to disability.", "Multi-organ failure can lead to death."]

en: Case fatality rate is estimated at 1-3% of infected individuals, most of whom are elderly with underlying health conditions.
es: Se estima que la tasa de letalidad es del 1 % al 3 % de las personas contagiadas, la mayoría de las cuales son adultos mayores con afecciones de salud subyacentes.
atomic_facts: ["Case fatality rate is estimated at 1-3% of infected individuals.", "Most of the individuals with case fatality rate are elderly.", "Most of the individuals with case fatality rate have underlying health conditions."]

en: The fatality rate is much higher for those over 70 but significantly lower for those under 40.
es: La tasa de letalidad es mucho más elevada para las personas mayores de 70 años, pero es significativamente menor para los menores de 40 años.
atomic_facts: ["The fatality rate is much higher for those over 70.", "The fatality rate is significantly lower for those under 40."]

en: Those most at risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications are the elderly and those with weakened immune systems or underlying health conditions like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension, chronic respiratory disease, and cancer.
es: Las personas que tienen mayor riesgo de contagiarse de COVID-19 y tener complicaciones graves son los adultos mayores con sistemas inmunitarios debilitados o afecciones de salud subyacentes, como enfermedad cardiovascular, diabetes, hipertensión, enfermedad respiratoria crónica y cáncer.
atomic_facts: ["The elderly are at risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications.", "Those with weakened immune systems are at risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications.", "Those with underlying health conditions are at risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications.", "Cardiovascular disease is an underlying health condition that increases the risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications.", "Diabetes is an underlying health condition that increases the risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications.", "Hypertension is an underlying health condition that increases the risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications.", "Chronic respiratory disease is an underlying health condition that increases the risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications.", "Cancer is an underlying health condition that increases the risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications."]

en: Not many cases are reported in children and most of these are mild or moderate, though a significant fraction do get pneumonia.
es: No se informan muchos casos en niños y la mayoría son leves o moderados, aunque en una porción significativa de estos sí se desarrolla neumonía.
atomic_facts: ["Not many cases are reported in children.", "Most cases reported in children are mild or moderate.", "A significant fraction of children with cases do get pneumonia."]

en: Occupationally, health care workers have higher risk compared to others with clusters of disease among workers and in health care settings.
es: A nivel ocupacional, los trabajadores de atención médica tienen un riesgo mayor en comparación con las demás personas, debido a los grupos de enfermedades presentes en los entornos y entre los trabajadores de atención médica.
atomic_facts: ["Health care workers have higher risk compared to others.", "There are clusters of disease among health care workers.", "There are clusters of disease in health care settings."]

en: The time between being exposed to the virus and the emergence of symptoms (incubation period) is typically between 2 and 14 days, though there has been one reported case in China where symptoms appeared 27 days after exposure.
es: El tiempo entre la exposición al virus y la aparición de los síntomas de emergencia (llamado período de incubación) suele ser de 2 a 14 días, aunque se informó de un caso en China en el que los síntomas aparecieron 27 días después de la exposición.
atomic_facts: ["The time between being exposed to the virus and the emergence of symptoms is typically between 2 and 14 days.", "There has been one reported case in China where symptoms appeared 27 days after exposure."]

en: There is evidence of transmission from people who don't have symptoms, although to what extent is still being investigated.
es: Hay evidencia de transmisión por parte de personas que no tienen síntomas, aunque aún se está investigando en qué medida ocurre esto.
atomic_facts: ["There is evidence of transmission from people who don't have symptoms.", "The extent of transmission from people who don't have symptoms is still being investigated."]

en: Long-term effects for people who have recovered remain unclear, but there is evidence of reduced lung capacity in some recovered patients.
es: Todavía no quedan claros los efectos a largo plazo para las personas que se han recuperado, pero hay evidencia de reducción de la capacidad pulmonar en algunos pacientes recuperados.
atomic_facts: ["Long-term effects for people who have recovered remain unclear", "There is evidence of reduced lung capacity in some recovered patients"]

en: There is no established test assessing for the virus or antibodies in the blood, although tests are being developed.
es: No hay ninguna prueba establecida para evaluar el virus o los anticuerpos en la sangre, aunque se están desarrollando pruebas.
atomic_facts: ["There is no established test assessing for the virus in the blood.", "There is no established test assessing for antibodies in the blood.", "Tests are being developed."]

en: There is no test to establish immunity to the virus.
es: No hay ninguna prueba que permita establecer la inmunidad al virus.
atomic_facts: ["There is no test to establish immunity to the virus."]

en: Many governments around the world have advised their citizens not to travel unnecessarily amid the pandemic.
es: Muchos gobiernos de todo el mundo han recomendado a sus ciudadanos que no hagan viajes innecesarios durante la pandemia.
atomic_facts: ["Many governments around the world have advised their citizens not to travel amid the pandemic.", "Many governments around the world have advised their citizens to avoid unnecessary travel amid the pandemic."]

en: Particularly avoid cruise ship travel.
es: En especial, se deben evitar los viajes en cruceros.
atomic_facts: ["Particularly avoid cruise ship travel."]

en: Older travelers and those with underlying health conditions are most at risk and should avoid travel that puts them at risk, such as long plane flights, visits to crowded places, and especially cruises, even outside of severely affected areas.
es: Los viajeros de edad avanzada y aquellos con afecciones de salud subyacentes tienen un mayor riesgo y deberían evitar los viajes que los pongan en riesgo, como los vuelos largos, las visitas a lugares muy concurridos y, especialmente, los cruceros, incluso fuera de las zonas más afectadas.
atomic_facts: ["Older travelers are most at risk and should avoid travel that puts them at risk.", "Those with underlying health conditions are most at risk and should avoid travel that puts them at risk.", "Travelers at risk should avoid long plane flights.", "Travelers at risk should avoid visits to crowded places.", "Travelers at risk should avoid cruises.", "Travelers at risk should avoid travel outside of severely affected areas."]

en: This means minimising contact with others by keeping a distance of six feet or two meters from them and avoiding gathering together in groups.
es: Esto significa minimizar el contacto con las demás personas manteniendo una distancia de seis pies o dos metros el uno del otro y evitar reunirse en grupos.
atomic_facts: ["Minimising contact with others means keeping a distance of six feet from them", "Minimising contact with others means keeping a distance of two meters from them", "Minimising contact with others means avoiding gathering together in groups"]

en: Drying your washed hands physically removes some germs from your skin (so don't skip that step, and don't share towels).
es: Secarse las manos después de lavárselas retira físicamente algunos gérmenes de la piel (así que no omita ese paso y no comparta las toallas).
atomic_facts: ["Drying your washed hands physically removes some germs from your skin.", "You should not skip drying your washed hands.", "You should not share towels."]

en: If soap and water are not available, then use a >60% alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
es: Si no tiene acceso a agua y jabón, use un desinfectante para manos con más del 60 % de alcohol.

en: A similar web-based study to Solidarity, called "Discovery", was initiated in March across seven countries by INSERM (Paris, France).During March, funding for the Solidarity trial reached US$108 million from 203,000 individuals, organizations and governments, with 45 countries involved in financing or trial management.

en: b'COVID-19 surveillance involves monitoring the spread of the coronavirus disease in order to establish the patterns of disease progression.

en: COVID-19 surveillance is expected to monitor epidemiological trends, rapidly detect new cases, and based on this information, provide epidemiological information to conduct risk assessment and guide disease preparedness.
es: Se espera que la vigilancia de la COVID-19 monitoree las tendencias epidemiológicas, detecte rápidamente los casos nuevos y, con base en esta información, brinde información epidemiológica para evaluar el riesgo y guiar la preparación contra la enfermedad.
atomic_facts: ["COVID-19 surveillance is expected to monitor epidemiological trends.", "COVID-19 surveillance is expected to rapidly detect new cases.", "COVID-19 surveillance is expected to provide epidemiological information to conduct risk assessment.", "COVID-19 surveillance is expected to guide disease preparedness."]

en: b'Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses that cause diseases in mammals and birds.

atomic_facts: ["Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses.", "Coronaviruses cause diseases in mammals.", "Coronaviruses cause diseases in birds."]

en: In humans, coronaviruses cause respiratory tract infections that can range from mild to lethal.
es: En los humanos, los coronavirus causan infecciones de las vías respiratorias que pueden variar de leves a letales.
atomic_facts: ["Coronaviruses cause respiratory tract infections in humans.", "Respiratory tract infections caused by coronaviruses can range from mild to lethal."]

en: Coronaviruses constitute the subfamily Orthocoronavirinae, in the family Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.

en: They are enveloped viruses with a positive-sense single-stranded RNA genome and a nucleocapsid of helical symmetry.

en: In the 1940s, two more animal coronaviruses, mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) and transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), were isolated.Human coronaviruses were discovered in the 1960s.
es: En la década de 1940, se aislaron dos coronavirus animales más, el virus de la hepatitis murina (VHM) y el virus de la gastroenteritis transmisible (TGEV). Los coronavirus humanos se descubrieron en la década de 1960.

en: The earliest ones studied were from human patients with the common cold, which were later named human coronavirus 229E and human coronavirus OC43.
es: Los primeros que se estudiaron fueron de pacientes humanos con un resfriado común, que posteriormente se llamaron coronavirus humano 229E y coronavirus humano OC43.
atomic_facts: ["The earliest ones studied were from human patients with the common cold.", "The common cold was later named human coronavirus 229E.", "The common cold was later named human coronavirus OC43."]

en: The name refers to the characteristic appearance of virions (the infective form of the virus) by electron microscopy, which have a fringe of large, bulbous surface projections creating an image reminiscent of a crown or of a solar corona.
es: El nombre hace referencia a la apariencia característica de los viriones (la forma infecciosa del virus) cuando se los ve por un microscopio eléctrico. Allí se observa que tienen una franja de proyecciones largas y bulbosas en la superficie que crean una imagen similar a una corona real o corona solar.
atomic_facts: ["The name refers to the characteristic appearance of virions by electron microscopy.", "Virions have a fringe of large, bulbous surface projections.", "The surface projections create an image reminiscent of a crown.", "The surface projections create an image reminiscent of a solar corona."]

en: The envelope of the virus in electron micrographs appears as a distinct pair of electron dense shells.The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer where the membrane (M), envelope (E) and spike (S) structural proteins are anchored.
es: La envoltura del virus, observada por un microscopio electrónico, se ve como un par claro de capas densas de electrones. La envoltura vírica consta de una bicapa lipídica donde se encuentran la membrana (M), la envoltura (E) y la espícula (S).
atomic_facts: ["The envelope of the virus in electron micrographs appears as a distinct pair of electron dense shells.", "The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer.", "The membrane (M) structural protein is anchored in the lipid bilayer of the viral envelope.", "The envelope (E) structural protein is anchored in the lipid bilayer of the viral envelope.", "The spike (S) structural protein is anchored in the lipid bilayer of the viral envelope."]

en: Coronaviruses contain a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome.

en: The genome size for coronaviruses ranges from 26.4 to 31.7 kilobases.

en: The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein self cleaves to form nonstructural proteins.The later reading frames encode the four major structural proteins: spike, envelope, membrane, and nucleocapsid.
es: La poliproteína replicasa-transcriptasa se escinde para formar proteínas no estructurales. Los últimos marcos de lectura codifican las cuatro proteínas estructurales principales: espícula, envoltura, membrana y nucleocápside.
atomic_facts: ["The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein self cleaves to form nonstructural proteins.", "The later reading frames encode the spike protein.", "The later reading frames encode the membrane protein.", "The later reading frames encode the nucleocapsid protein."]

en: The number of accessory proteins and their function is unique depending on the specific coronavirus.

en: Infection begins when the viral spike (S) glycoprotein attaches to its complementary host cell receptor.

en: The host ribosome translates the initial overlapping open reading frame of the virus genome and forms a long polyprotein.

en: The other nonstructural proteins in the complex assist in the replication and transcription process.

en: The exoribonuclease nonstructural protein, for instance, provides extra fidelity to replication by providing a proofreading function which the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase lacks.One of the main functions of the complex is to replicate the viral genome.
es: La proteína no estructural exorribonucleasa, por ejemplo, brinda más fidelidad a la replicación proporcionando una función de corrección de errores que la ARN polimerasa dirigida por ARN no tiene. Una de las funciones principales del complejo es replicar el genoma vírico.

en: The other important function of the complex is to transcribe the viral genome.

en: This is followed by the transcription of these negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules to their corresponding positive-sense mRNAs.
